alert.note: Alert for Davidson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 2:35PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Forsyth and north central Davidson Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 234 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clemmons, or near Winston-Salem, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Lewisville, Walkertown, Arcadia, Pfafftown, Stanleyville and Sedge Garden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
